background.description: The background shorthand CSS property sets all background style properties at once, such as color, image, origin and size, or repeat method.

backgroundColor.description: The background-color CSS property sets the background color of an element.

border.description: The border shorthand CSS property sets an element's border. It sets the values of border-width, border-style, and border-color.

borderRadius.description: The border-radius CSS property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge. You can set a single radius to make circular corners, or two radii to make elliptical corners.

color.description: The color CSS property sets the foreground color value of an element's text and text decorations, and sets the <currentcolor> value. currentcolor may be used as an indirect value on other properties and is the default for other color properties, such as border-color.

display.description: The display CSS property sets whether an element is treated as a block or inline box and the layout used for its children, such as flow layout, grid or flex.

fontSize.description: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font. Changing the font size also updates the sizes of the font size-relative <length> units, such as em, ex, and so forth.

fontStyle.description: The font-style CSS property sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family.

fontWeight.description: The font-weight CSS property sets the weight (or boldness) of the font. The weights available depend on the font-family that is currently set.

gap.description: The gap CSS property sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns. It is a shorthand for row-gap and column-gap.

height.description: The height CSS property specifies the height of an element.

margin.description: The margin CSS property sets the margin area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, and margin-left.

padding.description: The padding CSS shorthand property sets the padding area on all four sides of an element at once.

textAlign.description: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of the inline-level content inside a block element or table-cell box.

width.description: The width CSS property sets an element's width.

grid.description: Grid configuration, such as number of rows and columns.

margin.description: Grid cell margin

name.description: Dashboard name. Must be unique among your dashboards.

charts.description: Charts configuration. Only applicable if `type` is set to `Charts`.

color.description: Chart color (HEX). Example: `#ff00ff`

formula.description: Custom formula for modifying original data value.

group.description: Group charts by assigning a same group label (any string). Charts with the same group can toggle their visibility with a single click on the legend.

label.description: Chart label for legend and mouseover tooltip.

labelFormat.description: Custom label format using `sprintf` syntax. You can set both label (1st placeholder) and value (2nd placeholder). Example: `%s: %.6g`

legend.description: Whether to display legend for this chart.

pointSize.description: Point size (in px). Only applicable for charts with `type="points"`.

query.description: Query to backend for loading chart data. Example: `indicators{name='put.indicator.name.here'}`

styler.description: Custom function for modifying original point style properties. Example: `function (style, data) { style.width = 10; style.color = 0xff00ee; style.opacity = 0.8; }`

width.description: Chart width (in px). Default: 1px.

yAxis.description: Whether to bind chart to the left or right Y axis. Default: `left`

color.description: Chart color (HEX). Example: `#ff00ff`

formula.description: Custom formula for modifying original data value.

group.description: Group charts by assigning a same group label (any string). Charts with the same group can toggle their visibility with a single click on the legend.

label.description: Chart label for legend and mouseover tooltip.

labelFormat.description: Custom label format using `sprintf` syntax. You can set both label (1st placeholder) and value (2nd placeholder). Example: `%s: %.6g`

legend.description: Whether to display legend for this chart.

pointSize.description: Point size (in px). Only applicable for charts with `type="points"`.

relY.description: Relative position by Y axis [0, Infinity], but one screen = n -> n + 1

layouts.description: List of several possible layouts that the user can switch between.

levels.description: Levels bars to display on top of the chart. Only applicable if `type` is set to `Charts`.

anyOf.description: Defines chart level in a form of a line.

color.description: Level line color

opacity.description: Level line opacity. Must be in range [0,1].

background.description: The background shorthand CSS property sets all background style properties at once, such as color, image, origin and size, or repeat method.

backgroundColor.description: The background-color CSS property sets the background color of an element.

border.description: The border shorthand CSS property sets an element's border. It sets the values of border-width, border-style, and border-color.

borderRadius.description: The border-radius CSS property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge. You can set a single radius to make circular corners, or two radii to make elliptical corners.

color.description: The color CSS property sets the foreground color value of an element's text and text decorations, and sets the <currentcolor> value. currentcolor may be used as an indirect value on other properties and is the default for other color properties, such as border-color.

display.description: The display CSS property sets whether an element is treated as a block or inline box and the layout used for its children, such as flow layout, grid or flex.

fontSize.description: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font. Changing the font size also updates the sizes of the font size-relative <length> units, such as em, ex, and so forth.

fontStyle.description: The font-style CSS property sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family.

fontWeight.description: The font-weight CSS property sets the weight (or boldness) of the font. The weights available depend on the font-family that is currently set.

gap.description: The gap CSS property sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns. It is a shorthand for row-gap and column-gap.

height.description: The height CSS property specifies the height of an element.

margin.description: The margin CSS property sets the margin area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, and margin-left.

padding.description: The padding CSS shorthand property sets the padding area on all four sides of an element at once.

closestPoints.description: Enable or disable chart mouseover tooltip. Default: true

displayZeroLeft.description: Always display '0' mark on the left Y axis.

displayZeroRight.description: Always display '0' mark on the right Y axis.

fixedMaxY.description: Binds viewport from above to a fixed value for left axis charts. Chart values will not alter viewport top value.

fixedMaxYRight.description: Binds viewport from above to a fixed value for right axis charts. Chart values will not alter viewport top value.

fixedMinY.description: Binds viewport from below to a fixed value for left axis charts. Chart values will not alter viewport bottom value.

fixedMinYRight.description: Binds viewport from below to a fixed value for right axis charts. Chart values will not alter viewport bottom value.

focusTo.description: Sets chart viewport to a custom date (in nanoseconds). Default: current date and time.

followMode.description: Chart follow mode. Applicable only when displaying 'live' data. none - Viewport will not follow updating values. rare - Viewport will follow updating values when it reaches edge of the viewport. permament - Viewport will constantly follow updating values so that it always stays in the viewport.

label.description: Chart label. Used in the legend.

legends.description: Whether to show chart legends or not. Default: `true`.

maxWidth.description: Minimum zoom level allowed for this charts (in nanoseconds)

maxY.description: Limit chart viewport from above for left axis charts. Viewport top value can't be higher than this limit. Though, it can be lower if chart values allow it.

maxYRight.description: Limit chart viewport from above for right axis charts. Viewport top value can't be higher than this limit. Though, it can be lower if chart values allow it.

maxZoom.description: Max zoom limit - maximum time per one pixel

minWidth.description: Maximum zoom level allowed for this charts (in nanoseconds)

minY.description: Limit chart viewport from below for left axis charts. Viewport bottom value can't be lower than this limit. Though, it can be higher if chart values allow it.

minYRight.description: Limit chart viewport from below for right axis charts. Viewport top value can't be lower than this limit. Though, it can be higher if chart values allow it.

minZoom.description: Min zoom limit - minimal time per one pixel

serverTimeUnit.description: Chart offset from local time. Default: 0 - local time

url.description: Socket URL to acquire chart data from.

grid.description: Grid configuration. Only applicable if `type` is set to `CustomViewGrid`.

margin.description: The margin CSS property sets the margin area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, and margin-left.

padding.description: The padding CSS shorthand property sets the padding area on all four sides of an element at once.

textAlign.description: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of the inline-level content inside a block element or table-cell box.

width.description: The width CSS property sets an element's width.

background.description: The background shorthand CSS property sets all background style properties at once, such as color, image, origin and size, or repeat method.

backgroundColor.description: The background-color CSS property sets the background color of an element.

border.description: The border shorthand CSS property sets an element's border. It sets the values of border-width, border-style, and border-color.

borderRadius.description: The border-radius CSS property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge. You can set a single radius to make circular corners, or two radii to make elliptical corners.

color.description: The color CSS property sets the foreground color value of an element's text and text decorations, and sets the <currentcolor> value. currentcolor may be used as an indirect value on other properties and is the default for other color properties, such as border-color.

display.description: The display CSS property sets whether an element is treated as a block or inline box and the layout used for its children, such as flow layout, grid or flex.

fontSize.description: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font. Changing the font size also updates the sizes of the font size-relative <length> units, such as em, ex, and so forth.

fontStyle.description: The font-style CSS property sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family.

fontWeight.description: The font-weight CSS property sets the weight (or boldness) of the font. The weights available depend on the font-family that is currently set.

border.description: The border shorthand CSS property sets an element's border. It sets the values of border-width, border-style, and border-color.

borderRadius.description: The border-radius CSS property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge. You can set a single radius to make circular corners, or two radii to make elliptical corners.

color.description: The color CSS property sets the foreground color value of an element's text and text decorations, and sets the <currentcolor> value. currentcolor may be used as an indirect value on other properties and is the default for other color properties, such as border-color.

display.description: The display CSS property sets whether an element is treated as a block or inline box and the layout used for its children, such as flow layout, grid or flex.

fontSize.description: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font. Changing the font size also updates the sizes of the font size-relative <length> units, such as em, ex, and so forth.

fontStyle.description: The font-style CSS property sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family.

fontWeight.description: The font-weight CSS property sets the weight (or boldness) of the font. The weights available depend on the font-family that is currently set.

gap.description: The gap CSS property sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns. It is a shorthand for row-gap and column-gap.

height.description: The height CSS property specifies the height of an element.

margin.description: The margin CSS property sets the margin area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, and margin-left.

padding.description: The padding CSS shorthand property sets the padding area on all four sides of an element at once.

textAlign.description: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of the inline-level content inside a block element or table-cell box.

width.description: The width CSS property sets an element's width.

textAlign.description: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of the inline-level content inside a block element or table-cell box.

width.description: The width CSS property sets an element's width.

background.description: The background shorthand CSS property sets all background style properties at once, such as color, image, origin and size, or repeat method.

backgroundColor.description: The background-color CSS property sets the background color of an element.

border.description: The border shorthand CSS property sets an element's border. It sets the values of border-width, border-style, and border-color.

borderRadius.description: The border-radius CSS property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge. You can set a single radius to make circular corners, or two radii to make elliptical corners.

color.description: The color CSS property sets the foreground color value of an element's text and text decorations, and sets the <currentcolor> value. currentcolor may be used as an indirect value on other properties and is the default for other color properties, such as border-color.

display.description: The display CSS property sets whether an element is treated as a block or inline box and the layout used for its children, such as flow layout, grid or flex.

fontSize.description: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font. Changing the font size also updates the sizes of the font size-relative <length> units, such as em, ex, and so forth.

fontStyle.description: The font-style CSS property sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family.

fontWeight.description: The font-weight CSS property sets the weight (or boldness) of the font. The weights available depend on the font-family that is currently set.

gap.description: The gap CSS property sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns. It is a shorthand for row-gap and column-gap.

height.description: The height CSS property specifies the height of an element.

borderRadius.description: The border-radius CSS property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge. You can set a single radius to make circular corners, or two radii to make elliptical corners.

color.description: The color CSS property sets the foreground color value of an element's text and text decorations, and sets the <currentcolor> value. currentcolor may be used as an indirect value on other properties and is the default for other color properties, such as border-color.

display.description: The display CSS property sets whether an element is treated as a block or inline box and the layout used for its children, such as flow layout, grid or flex.

fontSize.description: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font. Changing the font size also updates the sizes of the font size-relative <length> units, such as em, ex, and so forth.

fontStyle.description: The font-style CSS property sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family.

fontWeight.description: The font-weight CSS property sets the weight (or boldness) of the font. The weights available depend on the font-family that is currently set.

gap.description: The gap CSS property sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns. It is a shorthand for row-gap and column-gap.

height.description: The height CSS property specifies the height of an element.

margin.description: The margin CSS property sets the margin area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, and margin-left.

padding.description: The padding CSS shorthand property sets the padding area on all four sides of an element at once.

textAlign.description: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of the inline-level content inside a block element or table-cell box.

width.description: The width CSS property sets an element's width.

fontSize.description: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font. Changing the font size also updates the sizes of the font size-relative <length> units, such as em, ex, and so forth.

fontStyle.description: The font-style CSS property sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family.

fontWeight.description: The font-weight CSS property sets the weight (or boldness) of the font. The weights available depend on the font-family that is currently set.

gap.description: The gap CSS property sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns. It is a shorthand for row-gap and column-gap.

height.description: The height CSS property specifies the height of an element.

margin.description: The margin CSS property sets the margin area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, and margin-left.

padding.description: The padding CSS shorthand property sets the padding area on all four sides of an element at once.

textAlign.description: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of the inline-level content inside a block element or table-cell box.

width.description: The width CSS property sets an element's width.

charts.description: Charts configuration. Only applicable if `type` is set to `Charts`.

color.description: Chart color (HEX). Example: `#ff00ff`

formula.description: Custom formula for modifying original data value.

group.description: Group charts by assigning a same group label (any string). Charts with the same group can toggle their visibility with a single click on the legend.

label.description: Chart label for legend and mouseover tooltip.

labelFormat.description: Custom label format using `sprintf` syntax. You can set both label (1st placeholder) and value (2nd placeholder). Example: `%s: %.6g`

legend.description: Whether to display legend for this chart.

pointSize.description: Point size (in px). Only applicable for charts with `type="points"`.

query.description: Query to backend for loading chart data. Example: `indicators{name='put.indicator.name.here'}`

styler.description: Custom function for modifying original point style properties. Example: `function (style, data) { style.width = 10; style.color = 0xff00ee; style.opacity = 0.8; }`

width.description: Chart width (in px). Default: 1px.

yAxis.description: Whether to bind chart to the left or right Y axis. Default: `left`

levels.description: Levels bars to display on top of the chart. Only applicable if `type` is set to `Charts`.

closestPoints.description: Enable or disable chart mouseover tooltip. Default: true

displayZeroLeft.description: Always display '0' mark on the left Y axis.

displayZeroRight.description: Always display '0' mark on the right Y axis.

fixedMaxY.description: Binds viewport from above to a fixed value for left axis charts. Chart values will not alter viewport top value.

fixedMaxYRight.description: Binds viewport from above to a fixed value for right axis charts. Chart values will not alter viewport top value.

fixedMinY.description: Binds viewport from below to a fixed value for left axis charts. Chart values will not alter viewport bottom value.

fixedMinYRight.description: Binds viewport from below to a fixed value for right axis charts. Chart values will not alter viewport bottom value.

focusTo.description: Sets chart viewport to a custom date (in nanoseconds). Default: current date and time.

followMode.description: Chart follow mode. Applicable only when displaying 'live' data. none - Viewport will not follow updating values. rare - Viewport will follow updating values when it reaches edge of the viewport. permament - Viewport will constantly follow updating values so that it always stays in the viewport.

label.description: Chart label. Used in the legend.

legends.description: Whether to show chart legends or not. Default: `true`.

maxWidth.description: Minimum zoom level allowed for this charts (in nanoseconds)

maxY.description: Limit chart viewport from above for left axis charts. Viewport top value can't be higher than this limit. Though, it can be lower if chart values allow it.

maxYRight.description: Limit chart viewport from above for right axis charts. Viewport top value can't be higher than this limit. Though, it can be lower if chart values allow it.

maxZoom.description: Max zoom limit - maximum time per one pixel

minWidth.description: Maximum zoom level allowed for this charts (in nanoseconds)

minY.description: Limit chart viewport from below for left axis charts. Viewport bottom value can't be lower than this limit. Though, it can be higher if chart values allow it.

minYRight.description: Limit chart viewport from below for right axis charts. Viewport top value can't be lower than this limit. Though, it can be higher if chart values allow it.

minZoom.description: Min zoom limit - minimal time per one pixel

serverTimeUnit.description: Chart offset from local time. Default: 0 - local time

url.description: Socket URL to acquire chart data from.

grid.description: Grid configuration. Only applicable if `type` is set to `CustomViewGrid`.

margin.description: The margin CSS property sets the margin area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, and margin-left.

padding.description: The padding CSS shorthand property sets the padding area on all four sides of an element at once.

textAlign.description: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of the inline-level content inside a block element or table-cell box.

width.description: The width CSS property sets an element's width.

background.description: The background shorthand CSS property sets all background style properties at once, such as color, image, origin and size, or repeat method.

backgroundColor.description: The background-color CSS property sets the background color of an element.

border.description: The border shorthand CSS property sets an element's border. It sets the values of border-width, border-style, and border-color.

borderRadius.description: The border-radius CSS property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge. You can set a single radius to make circular corners, or two radii to make elliptical corners.

color.description: The color CSS property sets the foreground color value of an element's text and text decorations, and sets the <currentcolor> value. currentcolor may be used as an indirect value on other properties and is the default for other color properties, such as border-color.

display.description: The display CSS property sets whether an element is treated as a block or inline box and the layout used for its children, such as flow layout, grid or flex.

fontSize.description: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font. Changing the font size also updates the sizes of the font size-relative <length> units, such as em, ex, and so forth.

fontStyle.description: The font-style CSS property sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family.

fontWeight.description: The font-weight CSS property sets the weight (or boldness) of the font. The weights available depend on the font-family that is currently set.

border.description: The border shorthand CSS property sets an element's border. It sets the values of border-width, border-style, and border-color.

borderRadius.description: The border-radius CSS property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge. You can set a single radius to make circular corners, or two radii to make elliptical corners.

color.description: The color CSS property sets the foreground color value of an element's text and text decorations, and sets the <currentcolor> value. currentcolor may be used as an indirect value on other properties and is the default for other color properties, such as border-color.

display.description: The display CSS property sets whether an element is treated as a block or inline box and the layout used for its children, such as flow layout, grid or flex.

fontSize.description: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font. Changing the font size also updates the sizes of the font size-relative <length> units, such as em, ex, and so forth.

fontStyle.description: The font-style CSS property sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family.

fontWeight.description: The font-weight CSS property sets the weight (or boldness) of the font. The weights available depend on the font-family that is currently set.

gap.description: The gap CSS property sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns. It is a shorthand for row-gap and column-gap.

height.description: The height CSS property specifies the height of an element.

margin.description: The margin CSS property sets the margin area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, and margin-left.

padding.description: The padding CSS shorthand property sets the padding area on all four sides of an element at once.

textAlign.description: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of the inline-level content inside a block element or table-cell box.

width.description: The width CSS property sets an element's width.

textAlign.description: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of the inline-level content inside a block element or table-cell box.

width.description: The width CSS property sets an element's width.

background.description: The background shorthand CSS property sets all background style properties at once, such as color, image, origin and size, or repeat method.

backgroundColor.description: The background-color CSS property sets the background color of an element.

border.description: The border shorthand CSS property sets an element's border. It sets the values of border-width, border-style, and border-color.

borderRadius.description: The border-radius CSS property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge. You can set a single radius to make circular corners, or two radii to make elliptical corners.

color.description: The color CSS property sets the foreground color value of an element's text and text decorations, and sets the <currentcolor> value. currentcolor may be used as an indirect value on other properties and is the default for other color properties, such as border-color.

display.description: The display CSS property sets whether an element is treated as a block or inline box and the layout used for its children, such as flow layout, grid or flex.

fontSize.description: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font. Changing the font size also updates the sizes of the font size-relative <length> units, such as em, ex, and so forth.

fontStyle.description: The font-style CSS property sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family.

fontWeight.description: The font-weight CSS property sets the weight (or boldness) of the font. The weights available depend on the font-family that is currently set.

gap.description: The gap CSS property sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns. It is a shorthand for row-gap and column-gap.

height.description: The height CSS property specifies the height of an element.

borderRadius.description: The border-radius CSS property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge. You can set a single radius to make circular corners, or two radii to make elliptical corners.

color.description: The color CSS property sets the foreground color value of an element's text and text decorations, and sets the <currentcolor> value. currentcolor may be used as an indirect value on other properties and is the default for other color properties, such as border-color.

display.description: The display CSS property sets whether an element is treated as a block or inline box and the layout used for its children, such as flow layout, grid or flex.

fontSize.description: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font. Changing the font size also updates the sizes of the font size-relative <length> units, such as em, ex, and so forth.

fontStyle.description: The font-style CSS property sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family.

fontWeight.description: The font-weight CSS property sets the weight (or boldness) of the font. The weights available depend on the font-family that is currently set.

gap.description: The gap CSS property sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns. It is a shorthand for row-gap and column-gap.

height.description: The height CSS property specifies the height of an element.

margin.description: The margin CSS property sets the margin area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, and margin-left.

padding.description: The padding CSS shorthand property sets the padding area on all four sides of an element at once.

textAlign.description: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of the inline-level content inside a block element or table-cell box.

width.description: The width CSS property sets an element's width.

fontSize.description: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font. Changing the font size also updates the sizes of the font size-relative <length> units, such as em, ex, and so forth.

fontStyle.description: The font-style CSS property sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family.

fontWeight.description: The font-weight CSS property sets the weight (or boldness) of the font. The weights available depend on the font-family that is currently set.

gap.description: The gap CSS property sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns. It is a shorthand for row-gap and column-gap.

height.description: The height CSS property specifies the height of an element.

margin.description: The margin CSS property sets the margin area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, and margin-left.

padding.description: The padding CSS shorthand property sets the padding area on all four sides of an element at once.

textAlign.description: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of the inline-level content inside a block element or table-cell box.

width.description: The width CSS property sets an element's width.

background.description: The background shorthand CSS property sets all background style properties at once, such as color, image, origin and size, or repeat method.

backgroundColor.description: The background-color CSS property sets the background color of an element.

border.description: The border shorthand CSS property sets an element's border. It sets the values of border-width, border-style, and border-color.

borderRadius.description: The border-radius CSS property rounds the corners of an element's outer border edge. You can set a single radius to make circular corners, or two radii to make elliptical corners.
